page.title: 12 Sailing / recreation
page.content: The main channel of the River Medway in Long Reach and Pinup Reach occupies the north and west portions of this block. While it is a fairly busy commercial waterway serving the docks of Gillingham and Rochester,it is also an important recreational resource. The deep wwater of the main channel means that large yachts with deep keels can use the river. On summer weekends the river is dotted with sails. Fast deep keel yachts built and rigged specially for racing such as Dragons and J class compete regularly. With their colourfull spinnaker sails they make a thrilling spectacle from a vantage point such as Darnet Fort. Alternatively tidal creeks such as Bartlett Creek provide sheltered waters where bilge keel vessels can anchor and spend a night. Creeks also provide safe water skiing.
